qas.question: What religious items did Kerry bring with him while campaigning?

answers.text: a religious rosary, a prayer book, and a St. Christopher medal

qas.question: What is St. Christopher the patron saint of?
What did Kerry do in the church while living in Switzerland?

answers.text: was an altar boy and prayed all the time

qas.question: Which part of the Bible did Kerry find the most moving?

context: Kerry is a <a0_0>Roman Catholic<a0_0/>, and is said to carry <a1_0>a religious rosary, a prayer book, and a St. Christopher medal<a1_0/> (the patron saint of <a2_0>travelers<a2_0/>) when he campaigned. While Kerry is personally against abortion, he supports a woman's legal right to have one. Discussing his faith, Kerry said, "I thought of being a priest. I was very religious while at school in Switzerland. I <a3_0>was an altar boy and prayed all the time<a3_0/>. I was very centered around the Mass and the church." He also said that <a4_0>the Letters of Paul<a4_0/> (Apostle Paul) moved him the most, stating that they taught him to "not feel sorry for myself."
